title: Multisite routing
content: Automatically create a department for each website and route the conversations of each website to the right department. This setting requires a WordPress Multisite installation.

title: Visibility
content: Choose where to display the chat. Insert the values separated by commas.

title: User system
content: Choose which user system the front-end chat will use to register and log in users.

title: Synchronize users
content: Sync all WordPress users with Support Board. Only new users will be imported.

title: Multilingual plugin
content: Set the multilingual plugin you're using, or leave it disabled if your site uses only one language.

title: Force language
content: Force the chat to ignore the language preferences, and to use always the same language.

title: User roles
content: Add comma separated WordPress user roles. The Support Board administration area will be available for new roles, in addition to the default one: editor, administrator, author.

title: Force log out
content: Force the loggout of Support Board agents if they are not logged in WordPress.

title: WordPress registration
content: Create a WordPress user upon registration.

title: Manual initialization
content: Disable auto-initialization of the chat widget. When this setting is active you must initialize the chat widget with a custom JavaScript API code written by you. If the chat doesn't appear and this setting is enabled, disable it.
